{{Notability|date=July 2011}}"'''Polyculturalism'''" is a term for an assertion that all of the world's [[culture]]s are inter-related. It is thus opposed to the concept of [[multiculturalism]], which its supporters argue is divisive. Polyculturalism was the subject of the 2001 book ''Everybody Was Kung Fu Fighting: Afro-Asian Connections and the Myth of Cultural Purity'' by [[Vijay Prashad]].
